contents-list.explanation: a person who watches television
samples: She is a regualar viewer of the evening news.

contents-list.explanation: the mother of your father or mother
samples: My grandmother used to make lovely cakes.

contents-list.explanation: a young animal that eats meat
samples: We saw a lion cub under the tree.

contents-list.explanation: a female lion
samples: I saw a lioness at the zoo.

contents-list.explanation: to take care of someone or something
samples: I can look after myself.

contents-list.explanation: to chase and kill wild animals for food or pleasure
samples: He likes to hunt and fish.

contents-list.explanation: a group of people who work together
samples: We worked as a team to put out the fire.

contents-list.explanation: to use weapons or physical force to try to hurt someone, to defeat an enemy, etc.
samples: When he was young he was always fighting.

contents-list.explanation: to be in a flat position on a surface
samples: Lie still.

contents-list.explanation: to cause someone to become afraid
samples: The story really frightened me.

contents-list.explanation: to cause pain or injury to yourself, someone else, or a part of your body
samples: Ouch! You're hurting my arm!

contents-list.explanation: to keep someone or something from being harmed, lost, etc.
samples: He had no raincoat to protect himself from the rain.

contents-list.explanation: to make the loud sound of a wild animal, such as a lion
samples: We heard a lion roar in the distance.

contents-list.explanation: to avoid a person or situation that makes you feel uncomfortable
samples: You shouldn't keep running away.

contents-list.explanation: a very tall African animal that has an extremely long neck and legs
samples: The giraffes' long neck is a product of natural selection.

contents-list.explanation: living in nature without human control or care
samples: Some wild ducks appeared in the lake.

contents-list.explanation: used to introduce a true statement which shows that another statement is not true
samples: He claims that he supported the bill, but in fact he voted against it.

contents-list.explanation: to do the things that are needed to help or protect someone or to keep something in good condition
samples: He takes care of his brother after school.

contents-list.explanation: a person who likes and admires someone, such as a famous person, or something, such as a sport or a sport team in a very enthusiastic way
samples: I am a huge baseball fan.

contents-list.explanation: continuing for a limited amount of time
samples: It's just a temporary job.
